intro: Ancistrocarpus comperei, commonly known as the Kauai ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is thick and fibrous, providing structural support in its native habitat. Ancistrocarpus comperei is known for its slow growth and is often found in moist, shaded environments on the island of Kauai.
